Title: Head of the NY Innovation Lab
Description:
Description
The ICG (Institutional Clients Group) Innovation labs is a global network of innovation centers focused on delivering cutting edge solutions to Citi’s Markets, Securities Services and Banking lines of business.
Our Mission is to create a competitive advantage for our clients, manifested as change in the way they operate, by providing innovative technological solutions with strong client engagement, from idea to production, and by leveraging the entrepreneurship spirit.
Our Labs Network is a global organization that spans across London, Tel Aviv, New York and various other locations globally. We focus on delivering innovative products using cutting-edge technologies in highly complex architectures and with the highest delivery standards.
The labs perform research and implementation in many advanced domains spanning across AI, Machine learning, NLP, Analytics, BlockChain and many more.
We are currently looking for an excellent leader to manage our NY lab and be part of the global network’s management team. This role includes management of group and team managers, responsible for several innovation projects in critical areas of the Markets and Securities Services lines of business. The ideal candidate is a senior executive with great passion for innovation and cutting-edge technologies, who’s both highly technical and business-driven, and with proven ability to deliver projects from idea to great scale.
Responsibilities:
Lead a large research and engineering organization with responsibility for a wide range of projects and domains
Lead innovation and incubation activities globally with the goal of finding innovative solutions with substantial impact potential on ICG
Manage executive stakeholder audience in technology by acting as a partner, trusted advisor and operating through influence
Lead technical processes and standards across the global innovation labs organization, related to DevOps, SDLC, EE, Production operations, ML & AI model lifecycles and more
Define and maintain a clear prototype/POC delivery handover process from the lab to the business-aligned technology units making sure the knowledge and expertise transfer is planned and executed in timely manner
Partner with the central engineering organization and influence the ICG technology leadership to ensure the technology development strategies are aligned
Create new and/or support existing ICG information sharing channels - technology forums, speaker series, online posts etc. - to disseminate the gained knowledge and expertise to ICG technology, operations and business community
market outreach: engage with external vendors and clients on technology and innovation activities
Host tech meet-ups with technology vendors, open source community and peer tech teams from Financial services and other industries with the goal of sharing lessons learned, practical experiences
Liaison with Citi Ventures to support its initiatives, including D10X projects, by supplying necessary expertise and resources; influence external and internal technology investment decisions
Support the marketing structure to provide regular updates to ICG technology with latest technology/science trends – opportunities they provide, business impact and strategic industry shifts
Experience & Qualifications:
Academic degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent. MSc or MBA – preferred
Strong and diverse technical background. Ability to quickly learn and understand new technologies, influence highly skilled engineering teams and overall have a personal impact on technology decisions and vision.
Vast experience with cloud architectures, and specific experience with public cloud offerings such as AWS, GCP, Azure
An expert level knowledge of the following technologies, included but not limited to:
Major modern operating systems – Linux, Windows, iOS, Android
Machine (deep) learning concepts and frameworks
Backend runtimes - Node.JS, JVM, UWP/.NET – with focus on concurrency and performance
Databases – RDMS, NoSQL (column bases, document base, key stores etc.), distributed databases, map/reduce based products
Programming language designs and fluent on major functional and object oriented languages
Networking stack and its use in low-latency application
Cloud stack – IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, Data Lake architecture (ODL/ODC)
Streaming platforms data flows, Serverless computing

Title: Director, Audience Analytics
Description:
Media Assembly is looking for a passionate media, data and analytics person with strong analytical thinking and the ability to uncover business and segment opportunities through an audience-first strategic thinking.
We are looking for a curious person, with a strong analytical ability (and who thinks like a business strategist) to mine and hunt for the right insights querying first- and third-party data and working closely with our senior strategists in developing best in class communication plans. This includes guiding our strategists through data driven segmentation approaches, marketplace analysis, and analytical and predictive modelling approaches to get us to key drivers of brand equity and business impact.
Provide guidance to our strategy and planning teams as well as clients on the most appropriate analytical and data driven solutions that best address their challenges, leveraging both structured and unstructured data, mining respondent level data from both custom research, social, digital and syndicated resources as well as work closely with our data scientists to unleash the power of our DMP Pii data upstream in our strategic thinking.
Work with our EVP Strategy to develop a new and proprietary analytical framework and toolset to support our broader comms strategic thinking. This includes building models to help us derive the key behavioral KPIs driving each of our client's business outcomes.
Work with our measurement teams to bring any relevant learnings from our media partners and closed loop, bringing in new insights to our strategist and planners so they can reiterate their planning and activation recommendations.
Work closely with our central data and research teams to support and guide them in designing successful research studies for and on behalf of our clients including sales lift studies, advertising effectiveness, brand and communication tracking and competitive analysis. Have direct ability to mine those data sets to help us uncover new insights for our strategic recommendations as well as broader industry award-winning case studies and white papers.
Produce analysis on emerging trends in media leveraging quantitative and qualitative data from Nielsen Media Research, MRI and CMR (in collaboration with our central team of data scientists).

Qualifications:
Minimum BA/BS Degree, but Master's Degree preferred
7+ years of work experience, 4+ specifically in the analytics, comms and business strategy fields

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Strategic and critical thinking
Business, media and marcom strategies
Data story telling
Strong analytical and communication skills
Previous experience leading large analytical project
Advanced analytics skills (strong SPSS, Excel, Tableau, R or Python-statistical programming) advanced and predictive analytics on structured, unstructured
Ability to brief data scientists on mining big data sets/Pii
Audience segmentation, audience development and targeting
New product innovation (support IP development)
Presentation skills
Cross media marketing knowledge
Research methodologies and design
Data visualization and machine learning (bonus)
Any general knowledge of coding (bonus)

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Decode_M

https://www.decode-m.com/

Data Science Manager : Job Description

We’re hiring a Data Science Manager in our New York office to lead Decode_M’s Data Science team in developing new solutions for our clients and advancing the science of momentum through our proprietary product.

This position, based in New York City, requires an interest in managing Decode_M’s data science team, workflow and offerings. It demands excellent organizational skills, a natural curiosity, an eagerness to dive into the deep end, and a hunger to learn and grow while having a blast. Expect to learn a lot about cool companies, new products, and the latest in analytics, research and strategy.

About You
You have an advanced degree in data science, mathematics, or another highly quantitative field, and are comfortable understanding and utilizing recent academic research in your work.
You have 3+ years of relevant work experience using applied statistics and/or machine learning. Bonus points if you’ve worked in a consulting, or other client-facing role before
You have 1+ years of management experience.
You are fluent in Python and R, as well as a robust numerical computing and data science stack in each language. Not only do you produce readable and well-documented code, but elevate your team’s work through thoughtful code review and mentorship
You are highly consultative, engaged, and detail-oriented. You see beyond the question you are asked to understand client objectives, and chart a course for long-term success in our relationships
You are an autodidact, who loves to figure out new solutions to problems by diving deep into StackOverflow, Arxiv.org, or your preferred destination.
You are curious, inquisitive, proactive, organized, and methodical. You like to use substantiated data to both identify and solve problems, rather than trust your gut alone



What You'll Do

Lead a team. Help to set the vision for the Data Science team and follow through on that vision. Be a mentor to a small, close-knit team of data scientists, helping them to develop professionally

Drive New Product Development: Decode_M has developed a proprietary algorithm to quantify the cultural momentum of brands, entities, people and movements. You will steward the development of the algorithm and be part of the product team to bring it to market with new customers

Manage Process. Work across teams and with Decode_M’s leadership to ensure that our work is top notch, deadlines are met, and projects are resourced appropriately. Foster an environment where the team is empowered to do its best work

Build Tools. Use data from social media, online reviews, mainstream media sites, search, web traffic, quantitative research, CRMs or other databases, etc. to uncover intelligence around growth opportunities and business challenges. Build software and/or repeatable processes to scale this work

Grow our Capabilities. Advance our expertise in applying statistics and machine learning to digital trends, CRM data, and quantitative research. Know the state of the field well enough to know when to reach for best-in-class tools and when to design your own solutions

Title: Data Engineer (w/ Healthcare Domain experience)
Description:
Data Engineer:
******** Must have Healthcare domain experience ***********
Job Description
The data engineer will contribute to a highly collaborative data analytics team in the following ways:
1. Design and execution of ETL automation for creation of a data warehouse (with structured and unstructured data).
2. Design of visualizations and reports.
3. Communication of report outputs to end users. Data interpretation and full comprehension of report implications – active ownership of information and content, not passive reporting.

You will thrive on the design and build of reports in addition to the validation, communication and iteration of information in those reports.
In this role you will be required to think critically and solve new problems in collaboration with a data science team tasked with development of statistical analyses and machine learning, with the goal of improving overall firm knowledge and inform decision-making. Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Description:
This role is part of the Core team within the Samsung NEXT Product organization.
The Core team is building today a set of large scale products that are directly linked with Samsung world wide and have the potential of capitalizing on Samsung's massive consumer reach across mobile phones and smart TVs.
About NEXT Product
The NEXT Product organization is a hyper-growth startup within Samsung NEXT. We're a globally distributed product development team in search of builders and creators to help conceive, grow and scale new products and categories.
Successful candidates, at all levels within the organization, will: approach all things team-first, take ownership and "be the change you seek", have strong written and verbal communication skills, have high EQ, enjoy fast-paced, outcome-driven environments and be inspired to learn and explore daily both inside and outside of your field of expertise.
The Role
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will build Machine Learning systems fusing and analyzing multi-sensory signals to solve real-world challenges in real-time. We are looking for a candidate that has industry experience with Computer Vision (Machine Learning) and has worked with large data sets and in real-time. This position is located in our New York office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with our Engineering and Data teams in NYC, San Francisco and Korea to build real-time solutions for Smart Spaces by applying Computer Vision methods to this complex domain
Build models for Human Activity Detection and Recognition, Object Detection and tracking and Scene Segmentation in real-time
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve ML models/infrastructure and software that uses these models
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
MS degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field
5+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning (CV)
Experience with machine learning frameworks
Experience working in an Agile environment and within a distributed team
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field
Research experience in Deep Learning
About Samsung NEXT
Samsung NEXT champions builders and founders inventing a more purposeful future. We attract, develop, and celebrate diverse talent with world-class capacity to transform ideas into realities at scale. We prioritize experiences over things and are dedicated to thoughtfully integrating the physical and digital worlds… and we accelerate Samsung's vision to inspire the world.
Founded in 2012, Samsung NEXT has four key functions in the global software ecosystem:
Product - Building new software and services businesses, at scale.
Venture - Investing in early-stage startups to help entrepreneurs build and scale their businesses.
Partnerships - Helping startups successfully partner with the variety of businesses within Samsung.
M&A - Acquiring startups to connect and scale with our businesses.

Title: TOMS Analytics Product Manager
Description:
Bloomberg Trade Order Management System (TOMS) is an industry leading, comprehensive fixed income solution for the trading community. Fixed Income markets have increasingly become electronic and require advanced analytic solutions to help manage the scale, speed and complexity. ETOMS is our electronic trading strategy and our aim is to be the global leader of Fixed Income Electronic trading solution.
Role:
We are looking for a Product Manager to help drive the analytics strategy building on Bloomberg's market leading platform. You will help shape the next generation of intelligent trading tools that leverage data and drive automation. The analytics strategy spans across the TOMS and ETOMS product which spans the full range of relevant tools for traders such as BI, automation engines, price engine, quoting engine, model engine, RFQ ticket, auto-quoting, STP, hedging tools, smart order router, virtual market trading. Product managers will need to apply working knowledge of every aspect of electronic trading to define the analytic product vision and detailed specifications.
Responsibilities:
The Product Manager will be responsible for:
Presenting the vision, value proposition, and development progress to senior Business Management
Influence cross functional teams including: engineering, sales, account management, support
Working collaboratively with other Product Managers to integrate analytic services across all relevant voice and electronic workflows
Documenting clear functional specifications (including SLAs) for each phase of product development
Ensuring projects are delivered on time, to specification, and that all development milestones are met
Qualifications:
Expertise in Fixed Income workflows across voice and electronic trading
Extensive experience managing complex projects and teams
Extensive experience working directly with Fixed Income traders
Asset class lifecycle expertise spanning Rates, Credit, FX, Derivatives
Experience with trading business processes including Electronic Trading, Pricing, Risk, Trade Capture, Trade Lifecycle, Business Intelligence
Highly motivated, consensus builder, collaborates well in a team
Detail-oriented with solid analytic skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent presentation skills including written, graphic and verbal
Ability to engage senior technology staff both internally & externally
Required Knowledge/Experience:
Working knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks
Intermediate level of proficiency on database frameworks, data pipelines and data analytic tools
Skilled in SQL, BQL, BQNT or Python (BQL and BQNT preferred)
Software development process (Agile methodology preferred)
Fixed Income electronic trading systems and order management systems Project management (status, risks, issues, dependencies)
The Company:
Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 310,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and two magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek and Bloomberg Markets, covers the world with more than 2,300 news and multimedia professionals at 146 bureaus in 72 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.
If This Sounds Like You:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/about/
Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: AVP, Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Citigroup Global Markets Inc. seeks an AVP, Quantitative Analyst for its New York, New York location.
Duties: Develop, test and maintain prepayment models, default models and Basel capital models for U.S. and international residential mortgage, commercial mortgage and other asset backed securities. Assess risk characteristics of securities and determine appropriate analytical approaches to facilitate risk management. Implement statistical models utilizing programming languages and cash flow analytics, including C++, R, SQL, Excel, VBA, Yieldbook, Intex, and Perl. Track market developments, including servicer loss mitigation trends, government initiatives, and home price changes, and analyze their impact on mortgage-backed securities. Develop advanced mathematical models to predict the behavior of seasoned and new origination mortgages, both domestic and foreign, and calculate regulatory capital requirements, prepayments and losses of mortgage-backed securities using machine learning techniques, linear and non-linear optimization, Monte Carlo simulations, stochastic processes, and numerical methods. Work with securitized products traders on evaluating bid lists and provide trade ideas and relative value strategies. Support the whole-loan trading desk in pricing of loan pools and build a price for evaluating unsecuritized loan portfolios.
Requirements: Requires Master’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Finance or closely related technical field and 3 years of experience as a Quantitative, Data or Financial Analyst, Model Validation, Quantitative Developer or closely related position in Risk Analytics or Loss Forecasting. Must have experience with: Analyzing large datasets using database languages and big data technologies and identifying trends using SQL, Python, and other database languages; Applying statistic methods, decision tree, classification, linear and logistic regression, and transitional matrix to analyze datasets using statistical packages such as R for U.S. mortgages, credit card debt and personal loans prepayment and default behavior using loan performance data as well as macroeconomic data; Maintaining and improving upon existing U.S. mortgage, and personal loan, credit card, auto loan delinquency, default and prepayment models using knowledge of consumer finance products and asset backed securitized products; Building stress testing and regulatory capital models used for Dodd Frank Act Stress Tests (DFAST), Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR), and Basel accord under defined modeling framework subject to U.S. regulators’ interpretation; and Coding and implementing models and packages using C++, Python. Qualified applicants submit resumes referencing job code EJ/AVPQA/SZ to Citigroup Recruiting Dept., 3800 Citigroup Center Drive, Tampa, FL 33610. Citigroup is an EOE Employer. This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Citigroup’s Employee Referral Program. Direct applicants only.

Title: Associate - Digital Transformation Office - Engineering
Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:
ENGINEERING

What We Do
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

Who We Look For
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

The Team
The Digital Transformation Office partners with Engineering and cross-divisional leadership across the firm to drive our Firmwide Digital Strategy to deliver differentiated and innovative technology and data solutions to our clients. The team is responsible for implementing the governance mechanisms and best practices that will support our One Goldman Sachs digital strategy to further enhance our clients’ experience and the firm’s operational efficiency.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
Partner with stakeholders to deliver objectives, key results and milestones
Develop detailed program plans and identify, monitor and track key deliverables and progress
Track program status, anticipate and flag issues and risks, and recommend mitigation plans
Communicate OneGS updates on a consistent basis to all key stakeholders
Develop presentations including supporting documentation for all levels throughout the organization
Solicit stakeholder input and coordinate amongst multiple groups to inform requirements
Understand, document, and improve existing processes in order to maximize efficiency in constantly evolving environments
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR

SKILLS
Self-directed team player with the ability to drive high performance and work independently and in a team-oriented and fast paced environment
Results-oriented with ability to manage multiple complex, time-sensitive projects with multiple senior stakeholders and competing priorities
Ability to drive consensus and influence at all levels and across functions within an organization
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Ability to manage change and balance strategic focus with tactical implementation/ execution
Innovative and flexible in coming up with suggestions and ideas
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree with 2-4 years of relevant work experience in a corporate environment, and/or Master’s degree
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills with a demonstrated understanding of project management processes, artifacts and tools
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to manage confidential information, exercise sound judgment and manage risk
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Proven track record of improving processes and demonstrating successful teamwork
Experience working with senior stakeholders with strong relationship management skills
Experience project managing the delivery of a new product or significant product change
Strong sense of detail and urgency, with the ability to motivate others to deliver
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with hands-on technical product management, large scale technical project management, and/ or software development
Experience with financial products requiring legal and compliance review
Proficient in major product management applications (i.e. Jira, Confluence) and analytical tools (i.e. SQL queries, Tableau data visualizations)
Prior experience in the financial (or related) industry
Self-motivated individual that possesses excellent time management and organizational skills
Full understanding of software development lifecycle best practices
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

Title: Data & Analytics Engineering Strategy & Innovation Lead
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The major focus for this position will be leading the development, maintenance, and execution of Cigna's Data & Analytics Engineering strategy and roadmap, and the identification, evaluation, and sourcing of innovative data and analytics technologies and companies. The technology strategy and innovation roadmap will be used to enable a $100M+ portfolio of projects in the data and analytics space, as well as lay out the future state of the technology stack for data and analytics across the Cigna enterprise. This role will work closely with their business counterpart to target venture capital firms, incubators, start-ups, mature commercial partners and academia in order to evaluate their capabilities and applicable technologies to further accelerate strategy and deliver differentiating and disruptive capabilities in the health services space.

This position independently interfaces with key senior leaders up to SVP level stakeholders from the business segments, the functional operational areas and IT Applications, Architecture, Operations and Security.

This position has ultimate accountability for ensuring the business and technology needs are met and the program is delivered on time within budget and agreed upon scope.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide thought leadership, contribute to, and facilitate the development, maintenance, and execution of Cigna's Data & Analytics Engineering strategy and roadmap in collaboration with key stakeholders and partners throughout Cigna.
Act as point of contact for Data & Analytics Engineering to other strategy initiatives across Cigna to ensure alignment with other relevant business and IT functions.
Establish strong expertise across the data and analytics technology landscape including venture capital firms, incubators, start-ups, commercial and academic institutions with strategic alignment to Cigna's innovation strategy and Cigna Ventures direction.
In collaboration with the Global Data & Analytics Innovation Lead, engage with business and functional leaders in the organization to identify and scope strategic partnership opportunities with transformative and disruptive data and analytics capabilities that have strong value creation potential.
Coordinate the piloting and evaluation of innovative partnership opportunities through a strong understanding of business and technology needs.
Perform technology due diligence on potential partnerships and M&A targets.
Serves as a senior point of escalation for staff, business sponsors, IT executives and key project stakeholders.
Act as a source of sound counsel to senior IT and business leaders.
Partner with the senior leadership from the Business and IT community to identify and prioritize opportunities for achieving the goals of the program/enterprise.
Provide consultative support in the area of business strategy development and solution assessments.
Attract, recruit, manage, develop, and retain talented team members. This includes both hiring and growing employees as well as effective use of consultants or vendor partnerships.
Develop communication plans and interfaces with matrix teams, IT leadership, business leadership, and external vendors/partners.
Track and monitor the progress of key projects/programs and their associated milestones and recommend adjustments as necessary.
Become a proactive trusted advisor to Business – develop relationships with key Business and IT matrix partners.
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Recognized leader with proven track record of delivering software engineering initiatives, IT-application initiatives, and cross IT/business initiatives with scope commensurate with $25-$100M program portfolio.
12 to 15 years of IT and business/industry work experience preferred, with at least 6 years of experience in a leadership role, and 8 years managing large-scale projects and programs, preferably some significant experience in healthcare.
BS or MS in Computer Science or other related field is required.
Experience developing strategic plans and roadmaps for large complex IT organizations.
Demonstrated expertise in innovation across multiple areas including: Big Data, data science, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence, IoT, etc.
Strong capabilities in planning and delivering complex partnership initiatives.
Experience working with venture capital firms, incubators, start-ups, mature commercial partners and academia.
Deep people and matrix management skills and a strong ability to influence VP level leaders within business and IT.
Proven ability to resolve difficult and politically-spirited issues and mitigate risks that have the potential of undermining the delivery of critical initiatives.
Consistently demonstrate key behaviors and skills such as leadership, communication, influencing, stakeholder/relationship management, thought leadership, and direction setting.
Consistently demonstrate key competencies: courage, developing direct reports, hiring and staffing, managing through systems, managing vision and purpose, and professional savvy.
Strong communication skills – ability to communicate to senior level executives in Business and IT.
About Cigna
Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. We offer an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products. Together, with our 74,000 employees worldwide, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation.

When you work with Cigna, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives while working together to make the world healthier place. What difference will you make? To see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Instagram.

Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.

If you require an accommodation based on your physical or mental disability please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Title: Manager, Investigative Analyst Unit
Description:
Company Description
ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at: www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!
At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.
Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.
But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.
It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.
At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.
At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce.

Job Description
Organizational Unit: VIS-Claims Analytics (ClaimSearch/MedSentry)
Expert level knowledge of medical provider fraud, waste, and abuse schemes within the context of the P&C insurance market
Demonstrated ability to effectively coach and train investigative staff on the detection of medical provider fraud, waste, and abuse
High level familiarity with medical billing practices (e.g., CPT, ICD, HCFA, reporting) in the context of the P&C insurance market
High level investigation skill including evidence collection, preservation, and criminal or civil procedure
Advanced knowledge of workers’ compensation and third-party liability insurance claim handling practices
Understanding and familiarity with application of analytical and statistical theories used to identify provider fraud, waste, and abuse
Ability to produce exceptional results in a remote environment with limited oversight

Qualifications
More than 10 years’ experience conducting or leading investigations focused on medical provider fraud, waste, and abuse in the context of P&C insurance markets or closely related industry
At least 5 years’ experience leading, managing, and developing outstanding talent
Bachelor’s degree strongly desired
Certification or designation in relevant field (e.g., CFE, AHFI, CIFI, CIFA, etc.) strongly desired

Additional Information
Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.
All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.
http://www.verisk.com/careers.html
Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Title: Postdoctoral Research Associate
Description:
Postdoctoral fellowships are available in the Laboratory for Next Generation Virtual and Augmented Reality Network Systems directed by Prof. Jacob Chakareski, in the College of Computing at NJIT. Technical aspects of the openings include a self-motivated engagement with the research team of Dr. Chakareski on investigations of mutual interest, leadership in writing research papers and proposals, and engagement in light-weight student mentoring and teaching activities. It is expected that a recruited candidate will lead the submission of two journal and one to two conference papers, annually. Dr. Chakareski and his team will provide ample support and opportunities for creative engagement.
Highly-motivated candidates with background in electrical and computer engineering, computer science, or applied mathematics, and research interests at the broad intersection of networked virtual and augmented reality, optical and millimeter wave mobile wireless networking, 360 video streaming, UAV-IoT sensing and networking, real-time machine learning, and societal applications are encouraged to apply. The fellowships comprise a competitive salary with excellent benefits and travel opportunities. Dr. Chakareski is committed to helping postdocs develop independent research careers, and identify and secure long-term job positions, and provides generous mentoring for developing grants applications, technical writing and lab management skills, and professional networks and collaborations. The openings are renewable every year, pending available funding and meeting performance requirements.

Essential Functions:
To work on information science and computer graphics. The Post Doc will help design and conduct research, analyze the collected data and prepare for a publication.

Prerequisite Qualifications:
Must have qualitative research skills and have a PhD in hand/or within 3 months of appointment. Experience with human subject research.
Bargaining Unit:
AFT-UCAN

FLSA:
Exempt
Full-Time

Title: Sales Operations - Data Scientist
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
This role has been created to directly support the US Sales Operations team and US Business Units. This role interfaces across the organization to answer challenging analytical questions and highlight insights to customers such as revenue generation ideas, opportunities and observations that focus on behaviors that reflect potential loss in advance. This position will provide creative solutions to help solve complex business problems using advanced analytical techniques while leveraging both internal and external data sources; along with frequent interaction with other cross-functional business units. The role will provide the candidate with an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Zoetis business and serve as critical support for our US Petcare. This position involves working with structured and unstructured, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking independently about solving business problems.
To be successful the ideal candidate will demonstrate a thirst for knowledge and natural curiosity that facilitates rapid learning of Zoetis business model and our data infrastructure at a scale that supports a growing $2b region. Analysts will produce insightful analytic data models and visualizations depicting Zoetis Sales Force performance , Optimization opportunities and proactive direction for our Sales Organization). Candidates must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, have the ability to work with limited supervision and must be comfortable in an environment of changing priorities
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand and use statistical predictive models such as regression and time series models to identify trends, make forecasts and provide projected figures
Perform machine learning , natural language , such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis and topic modeling
Develop new Dashboards and Self-Serve capabilities that proactively enable the Field Force, positioning data to leaders for Sales optimization and Performance Management
Drive initiatives focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics , in diverse domains such as product sales, marketing research, pricing; communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations
ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS
Internal:
CoE BA/SP/MR team
Commercial Leadership (US)
Species peers (US)
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Masters from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics , with a minimum of two years of relevant experience 2 years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist
Microsoft Azure – Machine Learning Studio, HD Insight,
Proficiency in analysis – “R” packages , programming languages ( Python )
Tableau Certification – Developer / Administrator
Strong knowledge in the following fields: machine learning , data visualization , statistical modeling , data mining and information retrieval
Strong analytical mind and in-depth understanding of key business drivers
Strong interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills
Fluency in English required
Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms and ability to work with SQL Server, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment
All Candidates should be prepared to discuss experiences and competency with SQL, Tableau, “R” / Python, Microsoft Azure
TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIRMENT
Statistics / Quantitative Analytics
Experience working with structured & unstructured data
Visualization
Business Acumen
SQL Server

Regular

Title: Product Manager
Machine Learning Manager
Description:
US citizen's only
Requires BA/BS with 10 years of experience with at least 4 years of management level responsibility. Incumbent has specialized knowledge in at least one area of expertise and a general knowledge in 1-2 other areas.
Prefers a Ph.D. in Computer Science with 15+ years relevant experience in Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning
Experience in writing proposals for Government funding (e.g., DARPA), managing projects, setting direction, managing small teams of technical people
Ability and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areas
U.S. Citizenship required. Security clearance is desired but not required.
We are looking for a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and proposal generation for a full-time position to manage a group of researchers in our Machine Learning and Data Analytics department. Candidates will work with teams to research, conceive, and develop prototypes, and should be adept at identifying successful approaches to complex problems. Research areas of interest include Artificial intelligence, Machine Learning, and applications of AI/ML to wireless networking, cyber security, vision, text analytics, etc.
This person will be responsible for managing a group of researchers working in the area of AI and machine learning and performing basic or applied research in these areas. Domains of application include and are not limited to wireless networking, cyber security, autonomy, visual analytics, text analytics, etc.
